parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or party affiliation.  The content is a general commentary on the political climate, not an endorsement or criticism of a particular candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and the content is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just a specific individual or small group.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. While the post touches upon the Romanian political scene, its primary objective is not to influence voters to choose a specific candidate. The message is a general call for reflection and caution, not a promotion of any particular political viewpoint or candidate. The image depicts a protest, which is not directly linked to any specific candidate or party.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post appears to be a form of citizen journalism or commentary on current events. It presents an opinion on the political climate, encouraging critical thinking, but does not explicitly advocate for or against any candidate or party. The link provided directs to an article on the same topic, further supporting this interpretation.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post expresses a general opinion about the political climate, urging reflection and caution. This is not intended to influence the vote for or against any specific candidate, but rather to express a concern about the state of politics. The image reinforces this by showing a protest, a general expression of discontent, not a campaign rally.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1505707436783892</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while politically themed, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post lacks direct reference to any specific candidate or party participating in the parliamentary elections. Its objective is not to influence the vote for or against any particular candidate but rather to express a general opinion on the political climate and encourage critical thinking. The image accompanying the post depicts a protest, a general expression of public sentiment, not a campaign-related activity. The post's content aligns more with journalistic commentary or citizen journalism than with electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Observator Constanța</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
